title: @Meddler, Could we clear up Riot's feelings about Vladimir? A while ago Morello said he hated Vlad.
body:
Vladimir was the third character I ever picked up in league, while I thought his default's hair looked silly all of his skins were impressive. Now that I heard he has been reworked I have mixed feelings. On one hand I would absolutely LOVE to see his gameplay get updated and be a bit more indepth and fun but I would hate for him to lose his identity.

To me Vlad is a blood mage, he uses the blood he gets to sustain himself through magical means while weaponizing the excess blood against his enemies. 

Ive looked through most (maybe all?) of the red posts so far and I have seen NOTHING about Vlad, Brand has been acknowledged in one thread, Zyra has been mentioned once or twice, Malzahar is mentioned on practically every post, there is even multiple threads about 'please don't rework vel'koz' and there was even a HUGE discussion thread about Cassiopeia.

Reason why I am worried about Vladimir the most is that Morello stated he hated Vladimir, his sustain and regretted him as a champion. I understand Riot isn't the same company as they were back then but I would really hate for Vladimir to be gutted because his identity isn't the best for gameplay. 

I also suggested [this](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/jQmE1EjE-mid-year-mage-update?comment=045a) in the main thread. I don't expect a response on that one but  its more indepth than this post.


So please could we get some form of response about Riot's previous feelings on Vladimir versus their feelings now?

(Also I tried to find a link to Morello's post but I couldn't find it anyway)

replies.body:
Our main problem with Vlad is his Q. It's a low CD, targeted, resourceless spell that restores health. It doesn't have much interesting decision making for Vlad, if it's ever strong early he just shuts a lot of people out of lane and the main ways to deal with it are to either sustain even more or to punish Vlad really hard when he trades. 

Vlad's also got a bit of a 'stat check' issue, where he'll just reliably outclick a lot of opponents 1v1 without sufficient avenues for being outplayed. That's not ideal, it's a lesser issue though since it doesn't kick in until later in the game when 1 v 1 counterplay is less important than team v team counterplay.

Does this mean that Q is one of the skills potentially destined to leave his kit? I'm sure Vladimir players (myself included) wouldn't mind losing it on the basis that we still have some way to sustain ourselves. In my mind, while there are other champions who do have sustain and in some cases it's core to their gameplay, none of them are as defined by sustain as Vladimir. He is the foremost sustain-man in League, and that needs to stay.

Other than that, thanks for coming out to answer some questions we Vlad players have!

I'm positive he'll be this sustain monstrosity but with added couterplay.
If I recall correctly the reasoning for him being a candidate for this type of rework isn't him not having a cohesive theme or being distinctive.
It's him being a stat-check champion who doesn't really have many avenues in which he can be beaten.
Think old Mordekaiser or Shen; Not much of interaction with the enemy laner.

But don't worry, all your dedication for Vlad won't be in vein, so don't think your cup's half empty, he'll be fine.

Hey Meddler. I've been thinking about this issue, and had a kit in mind to balance vlad at both ends including his Q.

New Passive: Blood Bank; A resource bar that fills whenever Vlad steals health from a Unit (Including Spell Vamp, Items, and abilities). As the Blood Bank fills it could increase damage and/or healing, but most importantly when its more than half full, it empowers Vlad's abilities. Blood Bank decreases when  Vlad takes damage. (This causes vlad to think more carefully about his engagements, does he want to build his blood bank to secure more damage/healing and keeping his abilities empowered, or does he steadily trade and diminish his blood bank.)

Base Q should remain largely unchanged except for number tuning, making it a solid last hitting tool with no blood bank, to a dangerous powerful weapon with a full blood bank.  When Q is empowered I like the idea of stealing other stats with health, most balanced would probably be Movement speed, maybe Magic Resist.

Base W again just number tuning, but when empowered is the best place to add mobility to Vlad's Kit. Empowered W could be a short range dash, where vlad pools into the floor, than that pool shoots in target direction, damaging enemies in direction and healing for % of damage done.

E is tricky because (Like Q) it has no decision making or counterplay. If its up and you're in range, use it. Its tricky because Vlad heavily depends on this ability for aoe presence, its how he remains largely relevant in team fights. I think this skill is ok to change as long as it remains AOE. The healing boost can be relocated to the Blood Bank.

R needs to change, and I like the idea of a Blood Curse (Too bad trundle's ult is nearly perfect for Vlad), or Maybe even a Blood Bond with an Ally, sharing stats or mitigating damage by diving damage taken between the two of them.

The takeaway, i want to keep a single target Q, and a Blood Pool. I would like to add a resource bar that adds depth to Vlad kit (Not Mana)
Balanced? Maybe. Healthy? Definitely not.

Constructive and Critical post for {{champion:8}}! Riot please read and comment, I think that these ideas can help your development team a lot! (especially coming from a Vlad fan)

          Vladimir is my FAVORITE champion in League. He feels so cool to play and he feels very unique. Vladimir's identity is in his Q, Pool, and passive. These three abilities feel very important to Vladimir that no other champion can do. Vladimir is known for being the best at sustain, but his Q is not broken or imbalanced right now because I have lost as Vlad many times, and beaten many Vlads. His pool is also very important to his identity because what separates a good vlad player from a great Vlad player is when to pool. Those two abilities synergize because they both heal him. If you were to discard an ability, discard his E, not his Q or W. Vladimir is the only hemomancer that we know about in league, he is distinctly unique simply because of his profession and identity in the lore.

          I believe to rework Vladimir EFFECTIVELY for the game, the community, and for his true fans like myself you need to further define what hemomancy is. Is hemomancy simply manipulating blood? What does it even mean to "manipulate" blood...  move blood around, to drink its life force, to shape it, or poison it? Is hemoplague the most powerful technique of hemomancy or is hemomancy capable of greater feats? Are different people's and creatures blood worth more than others? What is the goal of hemomancy? Why does Vladimir run around with a ball of blood, is that where he holds excess life force? If you look at all of these question then it will be easier to rework Vladimir. 

          Critically speaking about Vladimir's gameplay, his ultimate, and passive seem less engaging compared to other champions. His ultimate is a point and click AoE that is simple. And his passive feels like extra numbers based on items... which is based on money. His passive should increase Vladimir's power but based on kills and amount of blood siphoned. 
          How does Vladimir siphon blood? His Q and W siphons blood, Vladimir's E stabs enemies with BLOOD BLADES (hemomancy power). You could give Vladimir a BLOOD BLADE ability... that would be cool. His ultimate INFECTS (Hemomancy power) his opponents blood making them VULNERABLE to all attacks and then dealing large damage. 
          What if Vladimir's ultimate was similar to Nunu's, Janna's, Morgana's, Fiddlesticks, or Blitzcrank? He drains the life force of all opponents in an area for a duration while healing himself and procing his passive. This would combine Vladimir's siphoning/healing identity and his AoE identity on an ULTIMATE scale... This would give him an ultimate that flows better with his kit and would feel more ultimate. Also please include his badass blood lord Vladimir laugh when he activates his ultimate this way! Giving Vladimir that awe and power that he deserves! Im getting excited just thinking about it! Picture it... Vladimir's bruatally awesome laugh, he levitates into the air while the blood of his enemies flow into his blood ball! The visual affects would be so cool!

          Blood should be more important to Vladimir in game. Whether it directly impacts his passive instead of bonus health/Ability power (items/money). Or using blood as a unique resource for Vladimir. We know that Vladimir killed his teacher to complete his training and now has all the knowledge of every hemomancer before him. So we know that Vladimir siphoning blood EMPOWERS him. What if Vlad's Q gave him different stats based on whatever he used it on and healing himself. For example... If he siphoned Arhi he would get a little bit of permanent Ability Power that game or if he siphoned Riven he would get a little bit of permanent Attack Damage that game. And if he killed that champion then the permanent boost would be greater... this game mechanic is already used in champions like {{champion:45}} , so why not also Vladimir? This would make Vladimir's gameplay change everygame based on who he lanes against and the enemy team composition... making every single game of League of Legends with him different. But Vladimir's Q can't lose the self healing aspect. 
          This mechanic would be similar to what {{champion:75}} and {{champion:45}} does, but unique to Vladimir because his siphoning is based on the enemy and not himself. This also makes forces Vladimir players to be dynamic and Vladimir's item builds would change game to game. No other champion would be as dynamic as this, making {{champion:8}} even more unique!!!

          Also if Vlad gets behind he is done for... Thus giving him a serious weakness. Or if Vladimir DIES then he loses some stacks from his siphoning? Also this could be a weakness in and of itself... Because if Vlad spreads his siphoning too thin than the rewards wouldn't be as impacting. Forcing the player to be smart about his Q. This would make Vladimir's Q even more of an identifying ability. He would still lack mobility. And base attack damage. 

          I think Vladimir's history and lore should be fleshed out more in the upcoming update too. I would like to know what Vladimir has done since returning to Noxus. Has he influenced politics? Rivalries? Friends? What has he done with his powers to influence Runeterra? Who does he like and dislike and why? 

Also I don't like his hair on his classic skin. But his outfit is cool and fits his personality. 

I really hope the development team at Riot sees this post, this could help a lot!
